body:
config.mk 
1. ADD_LDFLAGS
2. ADD_CFLAGS

you should add the include and library path of warp-ctc  to the env variable
@sxjscience OK~
Looks good, can you squash and rebase?
Yes please!

thx for your help, now i can use 'cifar10.ipynb' step by step and predict successfully. and the next is I need to find out the predict result, as i know in mxnet the format of images is '.rec', so what's the output format, and what I need to do to convert to one format such as '.jpg' or '.bmp', that represent the result we can see directly? waiting for your help, THx.
How do I rebase in web?
how to set these two variable ?
I will update R package after merging #2491
Will update scala soon.

@sxjscience do you have any idea how we can implement it natively with the blas kernels we have? The simplest way will do explicitly slice then matrix mult, but I wonder if there are better approaches

depending on how complicated it is to share code between 3D and 2D, we can consider start with a 3D conv first, then see if things can be shared. @Godricly you are more than welcomed to lead a charge on this
cc @jermainewang
Let us remove the deprecated ops after one week it get merged. In the future, let us always make the op naming convention be as compatible as possible as numpy
wait until updates in #2518 merged in. sumAxis is now deprecated
@tqchen Linux travis is failing to install packages
Had exactly the same problem(in r), however switching from Windows 10 to Ubuntu 16 and building the latest version of mxnet and the r package solved the problem for me.
Why ndarray instead of float?
I'll merge this first. We can move the interface later
ndarray is async, so it won't force a sync point unless asscalar is called

I have done similar things before, we can use cublas batch function, should
not be hard.

On Thu, Jun 23, 2016 at 10:38 AM Tianqi Chen notifications@github.com
wrote:

> @sxjscience https://github.com/sxjscience do you have any idea how we
> can implement it natively with the blas kernels we have? The simplest way
> will do explicitly slice then matrix mult, but I wonder if there are better
> approaches

@ziyeqinghan Please rebase against the master. I will merge it.
@tqchen @antinucleon Yes, I'm thinking to directly call the BLAS kernels. I can ask @jennyzhang0215 to do that if it's not very hard.

Hello,

Is there any parameter other then **margin size**, **regularization coefficient**? I'm letting the user decide between **L1-SVM** and **L2-SVM** too, so it makes optional 3 parameters besides data and labels.

I made a toy test based on the gtc_tutorial MNIST example and had some bad time because **NDArrayIter** expects by default some **"softmax_label"**. I worked around calling **mx.io._init_data** and setting the **default_name="svm_label"**, but I'm sure I shouldn't be calling a underlined function. It looks like a _bug_ ;)

Right now I'm having poor results with my toy test, 7.01%, I believe that's because I should be training a SVM model. I got a bit confused whether K on the derivatives equations are SVM weights or node weight, after this experiment I'm pretty convinced they are really for SVM.

I may need to create two **new Tensor operators**, **L1_SVM** and **L2_SVM**, just like **Softmax** did. For now I'll just release the cpu version, but I'll be glad to try the gpu, I just don't have any experience, yet.
thanks this is great! Can we do similar renaming for broadcast_axis, maybe numpy.broadcast_to?
I have rebased it.
yes, there is a fix, see https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/src/operator/sample_op-inl.h#L108
@qiaohaijun
Great!

@tqchen `broadcast_axis` is useful when we want to broadcast along a single axis, e.g, `b = broadcast_axis(a, axis=1, size=100)`. I can add another `broadcast_to` operator that is similar to `numpy.broadcast_to`. We can also allow zeros in the shape argument, which means to keep the original dimension (like http://mxnet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/packages/python/symbol.html#mxnet.symbol.Reshape).
@tengpeng ,can you please post your solution here. I ran into the same problem and tried to replace to "ADD_LDFLAGS +=-lsatlas" but still got "cannot find -lcblas" error

Just double check.

`_random_uniform` has not been exported to the R side.
I ran into the same problem - I did a gitclone of the repo, then make clean, then make. I saw DMSHADOW_USE_CUDA=0 in the logs, however I still get the same message. Any ideas?
Did you merge changes from master to this branch? My previous builds in embedding could not pass  due to mshadow dependence. If was not able to compile until #2511 updated mshadow dependence.

@tmatas @tqchen

Great news! I ran the MNIST toy test on both Softmax and SVM with the same configuration for both and got **97.93%** for **Softmax** against **SVM's 98.15 %** with L2-SVM cost function and **97.97%** with L1-SVM. It looks like the paper was right!

I'll format my repo for a pull request, if you guys my parameters suggestion

Will my toy test be any useful for you?
it is _sample_uniform, check the Rcpp export rule, could get renamed to internel.sample_uniform
It should be updated in #2520

make a little change about Dockerfile

```
➜  warp-docker git:(master) ✗ cat Dockerfile
From dmlc/mxnet:cpu
RUN sed -i "s/archive.ubuntu.com/mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/g" /etc/apt/sources.list
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y cmake
RUN  cd /home && \
     git clone https://github.com/baidu-research/warp-ctc && \
     cd warp-ctc && \
     mkdir build && \
     cd build && \
     cmake ../ && \
     make &&  make install 
RUN export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/home/warp-ctc/build:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH && \
     ldconfig

RUN cd /mxnet && \
    echo "WARPCTC_PATH = /home/warp-ctc" >>config.mk && \
    echo "MXNET_PLUGINS += plugin/warpctc/warpctc.mk" >>config.mk && \
    make -j$(nproc)

VOLUME /work
WORKDIR /work
```

the problem goes like this 

```
root@f9df040f3302:/mxnet/example/warpctc# python toy_ctc.py 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "toy_ctc.py", line 6, in <module>
    import mxnet as mx

    lib = ctypes.cdll.LoadLibrary(lib_path[0])

    return self._dlltype(name)

    self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode)
OSError: libwarpctc.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

```

i try the following ones  just replace  /where/you/install =/home/warp-ctc/build here
1.ln -s /where/you/install/lib/*.so /usr/lib 
2.export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/where/you/install/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
sudo ldconfig
neither one is working

what  weired is when i enter the container and use the sencond choice  ,this problem disappear

Depends on https://github.com/dmlc/mshadow/pull/141
I did not use docker
I switch system from W10 to  Unbunt16.04  and problem solved.
I switch From W10 to Ubnutu16.04 ,train minist both on cpu and gpu  work  correctly. My Environment is  GTX 1080 + CUDA 8.0  + Ubuntu16.04 ,
yes infertype should be used

Hi, I reopened this issue because I found that blockgrad kill the grad not only for one variable but for all variable after it. I checked , after c and h, all grad become zero. is there a way to solve the issue I mentioned before but also keep the gradient? thanks!
@ZijiaLewisLu Could you provide some example codes on it so I can debug locally?

@sxjscience  Sure! Thank you a lot!  My code is at `https://github.com/ZijiaLewisLu/HeartDeep-Kaggle-DSB2`. Please have a look at`/Net/RNN/rnn.py`.  You can commit out all `import ipt`.  The data files are too big so I cannot upload them. For test, you can make up an array of  T(num of time step)_N_1_256_256, and a mark of shape T to tell the net at which time step backprop is required.
@ZijiaLewisLu I've checked the code. Could you further simplify it and get a minimal example that shows the unexpected behavior of `BlockGrad`?

@sxjscience  Hi, I am trying to simply it, but as I rewrite many functions, it takes a little time... Below is a graph of my original net:
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16264284/16355021/4b66029c-3add-11e6-89ab-a2e54c6249f1.jpeg)

Then I got the `need head_grad` error. So I added the GradBlock in two places:

![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16264284/16355028/8c22fd3a-3add-11e6-9e9d-8b8359f63f3a.jpeg)

As shown in the pic, the gradient after the GradBlock becomes zero.  Any suggestions about how can I fix the problem? 

I will upload the simplified net the time I finished it.
@ZijiaLewisLu I think that the h_{t-1}, c_{t-1} should be directly linked to h_t and c_t. BlockGrad seems to be unnecessary.
@sxjscience  How can I link them together??
@ZijiaLewisLu You can refer to the LSTM example https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/example/rnn/lstm.py#L17-L40 . Use previous state/cell to generate the current state/cell.

@sxjscience I read the example before. But the state is based on symbol operation. What I hope to do is to add c and h into output so they are in the form of ndarray, and the length of rnn sequence is not needed to be fixed. I am wondering specifically, why I would get the 'need head gradient' error, and is there a way to solve it without GradBlock
@ZijiaLewisLu Symbol cannot be mixed with NDArray currently. You need to construct the computation logic using Symbolic API and build an executor to do that.
If anyone else runs into problems with the setup - I used this detailed tutorial to get it to work: https://no2147483647.wordpress.com/2015/12/07/deep-learning-for-hackers-with-mxnet-1/

I also have troubles running the end-to-end algo. I'm new to mxnet, so I'm not sure how to fix it, this is the output:

I tried increasing the workspace in the model_vgg19 file to 2048, however this didn't help. Any ideas? Is it possible to use cudnn to get around this problem? How can I run the modell with cudnn?
It all depends how your last layer handles ur padded label.
Oh, only softmaxoutput allows ignore labels, but other output layer e.g. LinearRegression and LogisticRegression does not allow ignore labels.
see http://mxnet.dmlc.ml/en/latest/packages/r/index.html

The out of memory may caused because your input is too large. Current model
is experimental and I didn't do any optimization on memory. I will do a
refactor in next week.

Most time it doesn't matter.
This link may help: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/29274638/opencv-libdc1394-error-failed-to-initialize-libdc1394

I don't remember having problems installing on Ubuntu. What version are you using?
Try running one or another
- make -j
- make

the -j allows make to process in parallel. In your case it limits to 4 jobs in parallel.

Thanks for the contribution! Let us do the following things:
- Please rename the symbol as SVMOutput, as it follows more convention of SoftmaxOutput as symbol
- For now, let us move the mshadow's implementation of kernel directly to the mxnet repo, as it is likely less frequently used operations to compute the loss
  - Alternatively, let us think if we can compose mshadow ops up to directly get the SVM objective. I see there might need to be a index matching op, cc @piiswrong on possible

There is currently an NDArray function called `onehot_encode`. You can do the following

``` python
import mxnet.ndarray as nd

encoding_out = nd.empty((6, 4))
a = nd.array([1,0,2,3,3,1])
nd.onehot_encode(a, encoding_out)
print(encoding_out.asnumpy())
```

Ye...So if ur using those layers, u need to do some modification. I think the padded labels are also not  considered in metric. I mentioned it in #2410, maybe u need to double check on that part and correct me please if I made it wrong.

I also thought it might be because of the input, though I believe I'm currently using 640x480. What size would you recommend? I tried to squeeze the picture and dshape to 270:360. However it throws the following error:

Is it possible to increase the workspace's memory size?

p.s.: is there any way to contribute?

Ok, I can do that :+1:

I was also working on a version using Tensor operators, but I was getting segmentation fault. It will be on my fork soon

[Here](https://github.com/jonasrla/mxnet/blob/svm_vectorial/src/operator/svm_output-inl.h) it's the other version that should be quicker, since it takes advantage of broadcasting, but gets some memory failure, such as segmentation fault.

Also, I didn't put my name on Contributors yet. When may do the honor?

Thanks! It's the problem caused by unsuitable network structure. Now we r trying auto-encoders. However, we r wondering if we can use multiple GPUs within MXNet on training auto-encoders.
But when we read the examples, we found that, what is the rule to use multiple GPUs here?

---

ae_model = AutoEncoderModel(mx.gpu(0), [784,500,500,2000,10], pt_dropout=0.2,
        internal_act='relu', output_act='relu')

theres a parameter named context which specifies the devices you are using. U can find a [train_model.py](https://github.com/Godricly/mxnet/blob/master/example/image-classification/train_model.py) file in example/img-classification. Read it and you can get some idea.
@sbodenstein What's the current progress? I can also help implement this OP and do some benchmarks.
This looks more like a cluster config issue. Try write a simple script that reads data without using mxnet first and see if it can run

thanks，I solved it!
Is there any completed example on distributed yarn!  I completed just on ssh!!

I think I can fix this issue in _init_param, but other problems rises. To be able to infer the  parameters type, you need to pass in data and label type. So some changes like provide_type or sth are needed in dataIter.(Maybe we can assume dataIter data type as float32 to skip this).

I'll try to fix fit and __train_multi_machine fucntion in model.py, but I'm not sure with score, predict and model save&load.
Also the executor_manager.py needs some modifications to get DType works.

I'm not familiar with new module api, so I'm not sure what changes are need for that part. 

We need to create a TODO list after some evaluation.

I see some people are using pascal GPU in issues list, so more FP16 issues are coming. 
@tqchen @pluskid @vchuravy

Hey, @yuantangliang thanks for sharing. I will try it on ubuntu. I have checked the mxnet C++  version on windows10 with CUDA 7.5, cudnn v3. It seems works fine. So the problem might be how R using the library of CUDA on windows.

Can u extend the support to double type or DType(need mshadow support)? Or giving some hint on doing so.
Update: 
      testing double case.
same here

hello, @lugui2009 could you provide the full code then we can help you? from the error message, it means you are using the NDArray slice on axis like 1,2,3 which do not support, just convert it to numpy array using .asnumpy().
Please remark that to assign one tensor do another I had to create one tensor with all fields 0 then increment one matrix to another.
awesome! I didn't new the keywords. Thank you for the heads up!
the random currently do not yet support double type. Requires the random resources to be able to provide double number generators, which currently only provide a float one
That's due to the converter doesn't cover all cases yet. You are welcome to add features to it.

Two things about this:

It's not my freaking fault the Apple Machine can't download OpenCV properly.  As you can see Linux ran all test ok.

This latest version might be doing what the test expects to be done, but if I actually use it with the example it doesn't learn anything, in contrast to the first one. This is really confusing!

@sxjscience: I have had conferences + travel in the last 2 weeks, and haven't had much time to finish the cuDNN op (but have made some progress, will work on it this week again).

Can you start with the CPU version? I will gladly help once I've finished the cuDNN version.

@tornadomeet   Thank you for your reply.Yesterday,I read the code again.And I am sure I have  mistaken  this code .I have no idea of the concept of slice,and don't know what it is used for.Could you give me an template that how to write an DataIter of MXnet? Thank you again.

@mli @antinucleon 

enable dist_sync_device, which aggregates data on device first, before copy to CPU
also local_update_device can be used for test purpose, which reflects similar logic as in dist_sync_device

You cloned the code into `warp-ctc`, however in the `config.mk`, you config the  `WARPCTC_PATH` to `WARPCTC_PATH = $(HOME)/warpctc" >>config.mk`. So I think you can either change the `WARPCTC_PATH` to `$(HOME)/warp-ctc` or rename `warp-ctc` to `warpctc`
